summary: This FBI 302 form documents an interview attempt with Jean Luc Brunel on July 8, 2019, regarding a Federal Grand Jury Subpoena. Agents visited his modeling agency, MC2 Models, in Miami, spoke to his manager Jeff Fuller, and attempted to contact Brunel, who was in Paris at the time.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: The subject of the Federal Grand Jury Subpoena. He was contacted via telephone while in Paris, France, and agreed to have his manager receive and forward the subpoena documents to him.

persons.name: Jeff Fuller
persons.role: Manager at MC2 Modeling Management Agency
persons.context: The manager at Brunel's business, MC2 Models, in Miami. He accepted the Federal Grand Jury Subpoena addressed to Brunel on his behalf, stated he would scan and email it to Brunel, and provided agents with Brunel's contact information.

connections.description: Fuller is identified as the manager at Brunel's modeling agency, MC2 Models, and acted as an intermediary to accept legal documents on Brunel's behalf.

events.title: FBI Attempts to Serve Subpoena to Brunel
events.description: FBI agents visited the MC2 Modeling Management Agency in Miami to serve a Federal Grand Jury Subpoena to Jean Luc Brunel. They spoke with his manager, Jeff Fuller, and attempted to contact Brunel by phone.

keyFacts: On July 8, 2019, FBI agents attempted to serve a Federal Grand Jury Subpoena to Jean Luc Brunel at his modeling agency, MC2 Models, in Miami.
Brunel's manager, Jeff Fuller, accepted the subpoena on Brunel's behalf and stated he would scan and email it to Brunel, who was in Paris at the time.
The manager, Jeff Fuller, asked the agents if their visit was 'about EPSTEIN,' indicating an awareness of the connection between Brunel and the Epstein investigation.
The document is an FBI 302 form, dated July 18, 2019, documenting the interview attempt and contact.
